verses.roman:
prāyopaveśo rājarṣer
vipra-śāpāt parīkṣitaḥ
śukasya brahmarṣabhasya
saṁvādaś ca parīkṣitaḥ

synonyms: prāya-upaveśaḥ—the fast until death; rāja-ṛṣeḥ—of the sage among kings; vipra-śāpāt—because of the curse of the brāhmaṇa's son; parīkṣitaḥ—of King Parīkṣit; śukasya—of Śukadeva; brahma-ṛṣabhasya—the best of brāhmaṇas; saṁvādaḥ—the conversation; ca—and; parīkṣitaḥ—with Parīkṣit.
translation: Also described are saintly King Parīkṣit's sitting down to fast until death in response to the curse of a brāhmaṇa's son, and the conversations between Parīkṣit and Śukadeva Gosvāmī, who is the best of all brāhmaṇas.
